title: How to Draw Elmo

steps.headline: Draw a diamond shape but instead of pointy edges, make it softer with curved lines.
On top of the drawing, add two connecting circles for the eyes and an oblong in between for the nose.
At the center of the drawing, draw a line paired with another curved line below to imitate Elmo’s wide smile.
Add two smaller circles inside the eyeballs for the pupil.
steps.description: Sketch angled lines throughout Elmo’s face to make it look like his fur.

steps.headline: Erase unnecessary lines from the outline and color the drawing.
Draw a diamond shape but instead of pointy edges, make it softer with curved lines for Elmo’s face.
steps.description: Sketch an oblong for the torso.

steps.headline: Add protrusions from the torso to make the limbs.
Draw the hands and feet.
steps.description: Sketch a circle for the ball of the hand and five smaller protrusions for the fingers. Make the feet look wide and add curved lines to distinguish the toes.

steps.headline: On Elmo’s head, add two connecting circles for the eyes and an oblong in between for the nose.
steps.description: Don’t forget to add Elmo’s wide mouth. Add the pupils of the eyes using two smaller circles inside the eyeball.

steps.headline: Make Elmo’s body look furry by sketching soft curved lines.
Erase unnecessary lines and color the drawing.
steps.description: Red for Elmo’s body and orange for the nose.

steps.headline: Sketch a circle, box and another circle connected to each other.
steps.description: Also, sketch a cross at the first circle to show the center lines of the face.

steps.headline: Add the guide for the legs, hands, and lower extremities using lines and circles.
Sketch 4 lines in each circle of the hand for the fingers, and add the guide of the nose and eyes as circles connected to each other.
steps.description: The nose should be slightly bigger than the eyes.

steps.headline: Sketch circles for the shape of the fingers and toes.
Add the guide for the mouth and add the shape of the thighs and the arms.
Draw the basic outline of Elmo.
steps.description: Use zigzag lines for the fur.

steps.headline: Add more details and erase the guides.
Color Elmo.
Sketch the main body and head of Elmo as 2 circles.
steps.description: Add a guideline showing where Elmo is facing

steps.headline: Add the guides of the legs, arms, hands, and feet as lines and circles.
Sketch the guide of the mouth, eyes, and nose.
steps.description: The eyes and nose should be of the same size.

steps.headline: Add the shape of the fingers and toes as circles.
steps.description: Draw only 4 circles each hand or feet.

steps.headline: Add the guide for the mouth and add the shape of the thighs and the arms.
Draw the basic outline of Elmo by using curved zigzag lines.
Add more detail.
Color Elmo.

tyn: Colored pencils, crayons, markers or watercolors
text: Elmo's Face Draw a diamond shape but instead of pointy edges, make it softer with curved lines.  On top of the drawing, add two connecting circles for the eyes and an oblong in between for the nose.  At the center of the drawing, draw a line paired with another curved line below to imitate Elmo’s wide smile.  Add two smaller circles inside the eyeballs for the pupil. Sketch angled lines throughout Elmo’s face to make it look like his fur. Erase unnecessary lines from the outline and color the drawing.  Elmo's Face and Body Draw a diamond shape but instead of pointy edges, make it softer with curved lines for Elmo’s face. Sketch an oblong for the torso. Add protrusions from the torso to make the limbs.  Draw the hands and feet. Sketch a circle for the ball of the hand and five smaller protrusions for the fingers. Make the feet look wide and add curved lines to distinguish the toes. On Elmo’s head, add two connecting circles for the eyes and an oblong in between for the nose. Don’t forget to add Elmo’s wide mouth. Add the pupils of the eyes using two smaller circles inside the eyeball. Make Elmo’s body look furry by sketching soft curved lines.  Erase unnecessary lines and color the drawing. Red for Elmo’s body and orange for the nose. Jumping Elmo Sketch a circle, box and another circle connected to each other. Also, sketch a cross at the first circle to show the center lines of the face. Add the guide for the legs, hands, and lower extremities using lines and circles.  Sketch 4 lines in each circle of the hand for the fingers, and add the guide of the nose and eyes as circles connected to each other. The nose should be slightly bigger than the eyes. Sketch circles for the shape of the fingers and toes.  Add the guide for the mouth and add the shape of the thighs and the arms.  Draw the basic outline of Elmo. Use zigzag lines for the fur. Add more details and erase the guides.  Color Elmo.  Waving Elmo Sketch the main body and head of Elmo as 2 circles. Add a guideline showing where Elmo is facing Add the guides of the legs, arms, hands, and feet as lines and circles.  Sketch the guide of the mouth, eyes, and nose. The eyes and nose should be of the same size. Add the shape of the fingers and toes as circles. Draw only 4 circles each hand or feet. Add the guide for the mouth and add the shape of the thighs and the arms.  Draw the basic outline of Elmo by using curved zigzag lines. Erase the pencil marks. Add more detail.  Color Elmo.
sentences: Elmo's Face Draw a diamond shape but instead of pointy edges, make it softer with curved lines.
On top of the drawing, add two connecting circles for the eyes and an oblong in between for the nose.
At the center of the drawing, draw a line paired with another curved line below to imitate Elmo’s wide smile.
Add two smaller circles inside the eyeballs for the pupil.
Sketch angled lines throughout Elmo’s face to make it look like his fur.
Erase unnecessary lines from the outline and color the drawing.
Elmo's Face and Body Draw a diamond shape but instead of pointy edges, make it softer with curved lines for Elmo’s face.
Sketch an oblong for the torso.
Add protrusions from the torso to make the limbs.
Draw the hands and feet.
Sketch a circle for the ball of the hand and five smaller protrusions for the fingers.
Make the feet look wide and add curved lines to distinguish the toes.
On Elmo’s head, add two connecting circles for the eyes and an oblong in between for the nose.
Don’t forget to add Elmo’s wide mouth.
Add the pupils of the eyes using two smaller circles inside the eyeball.
Make Elmo’s body look furry by sketching soft curved lines.
Erase unnecessary lines and color the drawing.
Red for Elmo’s body and orange for the nose.
Jumping Elmo Sketch a circle, box and another circle connected to each other.
Also, sketch a cross at the first circle to show the center lines of the face.
Add the guide for the legs, hands, and lower extremities using lines and circles.
Sketch 4 lines in each circle of the hand for the fingers, and add the guide of the nose and eyes as circles connected to each other.
The nose should be slightly bigger than the eyes.
Sketch circles for the shape of the fingers and toes.
Add the guide for the mouth and add the shape of the thighs and the arms.
Draw the basic outline of Elmo.
Use zigzag lines for the fur.
Add more details and erase the guides.
Color Elmo.
Waving Elmo Sketch the main body and head of Elmo as 2 circles.
Add a guideline showing where Elmo is facing Add the guides of the legs, arms, hands, and feet as lines and circles.
Sketch the guide of the mouth, eyes, and nose.
The eyes and nose should be of the same size.
Add the shape of the fingers and toes as circles.
Draw only 4 circles each hand or feet.
Add the guide for the mouth and add the shape of the thighs and the arms.
Draw the basic outline of Elmo by using curved zigzag lines.
Erase the pencil marks.
Add more detail.
Color Elmo.
